title: How to Choose Multibagger Stocks for 2015 (pinto disoza)
text: By pinto disoza Sep 2, 2015 Multi-bagger is a term used for stocks that may multiply money over the next couple of years for an investor. A term used to describe stocks that have potential to render explosive growth through the period. Consult multibagger stock advisor to take a wise decision for your investment. Putting it another way round, it deals with the process of identifying tomorrow's high performing stock from today's small cap stock. When you are looking for investing, you should not just blindly choose the multi-baggers based on advice. It would be a better idea to develop your own tools with help of analytical filters and you can then choose multi-baggers from your analysis. A 2-bagger stock will make your price double fold and 10-bagger will multiply your investments by 10 fold. Multi-bagger is good to have and everyone is chasing to invest with these amazing stocks. There are companies that make per share earnings grow by huge amounts every year. These are companies with economic moats. People often confused these with companies with those having a well-known brand. A reputed brand is a good indicator, but all companies having a strong brand are not necessarily potential multi-baggers. Here is the list of methodologies that you can adopt in choosing multibagger stocks for 2015: Debt Level is Important When you are looking after for a multi-bagger, it is essential to choose a company that can multiply the worth of its stocks over the next few years. Before choosing stock, you should identify whether the book value is growing at the same rate. If earning per share (EPS) is growing at the rate of 30% p.a, it needs to make sure that debt is not growing at more than this rate. If debt is less than equity, then only you can take stock as a genuine multi-bagger. Quarterly Performance Get a look over quarterly performance of revenue and net profit. Revenue and EBITDA reflect clear picture of the company's operating performance. Source of Earnings Have a look on the sources of earnings of the company. If the potential to grow the business is vast for a company in its segment, it would be better to take position now. It is not wise to look on capitalization category (mid, large or small cap), rather have a look at scalability of the operations. Investment may take time to replicate profits, however if you are confident about business potential then be patient and give time to your investments to reap. EPS and Price Multiples Take a look at Earnings per Share and price multiples. Stocks prices may change on the quarterly performance as reported by the company. Be a wise investor, you should calculate trailing Twelve Months basic EPS and revenue, then compute current Price to EPS and Price to Sales respectively. These price multiples provide accurate valuation of a company. If a company is performing significantly well and its EPS is growing better, then you can consider it right chance for investment. Structural Change from Quarterly Presentations Overall, investors should read thoroughly the quarterly presentations provided by companies. Track recent announcements related to structural changes in the company, capital expenditure, and other management decisions. Looking to invest with multibagger stocks in 2015, consult our advisors.
